image.altText: Women cry over the coffin

props.synopsis: The Yolŋu and Mayili man died last month at the age of 61, after a life spent advancing the rights and self-determination of Indigenous Australians.

title.children: Indigenous land rights champion Dr Bush-Blanasi farewelled in emotional state funeral in Darwin

image.altText: A group of people standing outside in a carpark with a sign for Casuarina Square in the background

props.synopsis: NT Police arrest a man after a brawl involving up to 50 people at Darwin's busy Casuarina shopping centre saw one youth allegedly running at shoppers wielding a machete.

title.children: Teen tasered amid mass brawl at popular Darwin shopping centre

image.altText: An map superimposed over a harbour inlet looking like a torn page.

props.synopsis: A multi-billion-dollar taxpayer-funded extension plan for Darwin Harbour is being slammed by Pacific neighbours and environmental groups, saying it represents a major fossil fuel subsidy.

title.children: Darwin Harbour Middle Arm expansion plan slammed by critics as 'extraordinary fossil fuel subsidy'

image.altText: Woman with head in hands with tax return on screen in the background.

props.synopsis: The inspector-general of taxation is investigating the theft and hijacking of personal information that has allowed millions of dollars of tax fraud by professional scammers.

title.children: Inspector-General of Taxation investigates ATO myGov scams

image.altText: A close-up of Lisa Wilkinson smiling.

props.synopsis: Lisa Wilkinson is facing a second day of cross-examination as she defends a defamation case brought by former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: Lisa Wilkinson's objectivity questioned after revelation she accused Linda Reynolds of 'lying through her teeth'

image.altText: Stills of video which played a role in the Australian's four month investigation

props.synopsis: The South Australian government refers allegations over the origins of First Nations artwork to "investigative agencies". A review panel had considered claims that non-Indigenous staff members from the APY Arts Centre Collective intervened in artworks and made efforts to conceal the activity.

title.children: Review into origins of First Nations artwork refers allegations to investigative agencies

image.altText: thumb

props.synopsis: After 17 years and close to 800 episodes, the boys from ABC's Tales from the Tinny are hanging up their rods and calling it a day, recording their final episode.

title.children: Tales from the Tinny isn't your standard fishing podcast. Here are its most outrageous moments

image.altText: A map of northern Australia, with areas highlighted for a chance of a tropical cyclone across far north Queensland and the NT

props.synopsis: The remnants of ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper are expected to move west over the Northern Territory's Top End over the next week, with a 35 per cent chance the system could re-intensify into a cyclone.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper is sweeping over Cape York. Here's what it could do next

image.altText: Two children draw, smiling.

props.synopsis: Families say childhood dementia is underfunded and under-researched and they want greater public awareness to help improve their children's short lives.

title.children: Jill knew her children had a problem. It turned out to be kids' dementia

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood adjusts his baggy green on his head

props.synopsis: Australia looks to bat long against Pakistan on day two of the first Test at Perth Stadium. Follow all the updates in our live blog.

title.children: Aussies fight to find breakthrough as Pakistan digs in on day two

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: MITCH MARSH IS OUT FIRST BALL AFTER LUNCH!!

image.altText: The crumpled front of a white BMW SUV, surrounded by emergency services tape.

props.synopsis: The driver of an SUV that crashed into patrons outside a regional Victorian pub last month, killing five people, is granted bail by a Melbourne magistrate.

title.children: Lawyer for diabetic Daylesford pub crash driver tells court his client is a 'model patient'

image.altText: Barry Humphries stands with his family in front of a plane in an undated photo

props.synopsis: Royalty, prime ministers and some of entertainment's biggest names join the family of Barry Humphries to farewell the entertainer at the Sydney Opera House. Look back at our coverage of his memorial service.

title.children: Candid family photos of Barry Humphries shared at Sydney memorial for Dame Edna creator

image.altText: Composite image of three pictures of Barry Humphries as Dame Edna, starting with the oldest on the left and newest on the right

props.synopsis: She's one of Barry Humphries's most famous characters, but who was Edna before she was a Dame? Before she was an international sensation? Ahead of Humphries's state memorial today, look back on the late comedian's story of how Edna came to be.

title.children: Barry Humphries on why Dame Edna will always remain 'rather timeless'

image.altText: Steven Miles addresses the crowd from a podium

props.synopsis: After being elected unopposed by the Labor Caucus this morning, Steven Miles gives his maiden speech and vows to boost emission reduction targets and to address youth crime and the housing crisis.

title.children: New Queensland premier Steven Miles outlines his priorities for 2024

image.altText: Image of girl with back turned in classroom.

props.synopsis: A Hunter Valley mother is calling on education officials to find a support unit for her autistic seven-year-old, and says multiple suspensions and class time spent "playing Lego on her own little table" do not help.

title.children: Mother says her girl needs more than Lego for support, after being suspended five times in three months

image.altText: A selfie shot of a young Caucasian woman with blonde hair, outside in the savannah with an elephant and two rangers behind her.

props.synopsis: A Victorian coroner finds it is "possible" the 20-year-old was attacked before her 2016 death in Mozambique, in a finding her family hope will push local authorities to continue their investigation.

title.children: Family of Australian woman found dead in Mozambique disappointed at coronial finding

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, Joe Biden, and Rishi Sunak at the launch of the AUKUS deal in the US

props.synopsis: Australia's acquisition of nuclear-powered submarines hits another major milestone, as supporters of the deal seek to ease concerns that it could be torn up by a future US president.

title.children: AUKUS backers insist future presidents can be trusted as laws pass US Congress

image.altText: Man in all black runs from a grey car on a suburban street

props.synopsis: Police hope the vision will help catch those who fatally shot 18-year-old Salim Hamze and his father Toufik in Sydney's west two years ago.

title.children: 'Confronting' CCTV shows moments before father and son gunned down outside Sydney home

image.altText: A page in the Voice to Parliament referendum booklet highlighting the need to read information from trusted sources

props.synopsis: This year marked a decade since fact checking became serious business in Australia, and if 2023 proved anything, it's that misinformation isn't going anywhere anytime soon.

title.children: One of the most pervasive pieces of misinformation in 2023 was a claim on Indigenous spending

image.altText: A woman with dark short hair and a pink and orange patterned dress squints.

props.synopsis: A new police unit is being established in the Northern Territory to tackle alcohol-fuelled crime, as the government attempts to reassure the public it's devoting resources to addressing antisocial behaviour.

title.children: NT government promises 50 extra police for crime and antisocial behaviour prevention unit

image.altText: Pedestrians scramble to cross a Sydney street

props.synopsis: The ACCC has criticised banks for not passing on higher interest rates to customers with savings accounts, while the ASX has closed higher in response to rate cut optimism out of the US and Europe. See how the day unfolded on our live blog.

title.children: Consumer watchdog criticises banks over customers missing out on higher savings rates, ASX jumps on rate cut optimism — as it happened

image.altText: Four syringes of compounded semaglutide, lying on a table.

props.synopsis: Australia's medicines regulator issues a public safety warning over unauthorised replicas of the popular weight loss drug Ozempic, after an ABC investigation revealed hundreds of patients have been ordering off-brand versions online.

title.children: TGA issues safety alert after compounding pharmacies use 'loophole' to make Ozempic replicas

image.altText: Man carries young children wearing yellow jumper with blood on their face.

props.synopsis: The IDF says it has recovered the body of Elia Toledano, who was taken by Hamas and held in the Gaza Strip since October 7.

title.children: Israeli special forces say they've recovered the body of a 28-year-old hostage

image.altText: A man wearing a suit holds his hands in prayer position. He wears gold jewellery

props.synopsis: A well-known Thai fugitive known as "Wealthy Pang" has been on the run since October, and his TikTok videos taunting the police chasing him have stirred up some serious questions about corruption and misconduct in the country's most powerful institutions.

title.children: Thai police are hunting a notorious fugitive in the jungle. 'Wealthy' Pang is daring them to catch him

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks annoyed as he addresses the media

props.synopsis: For an issue in which Australia is not a player and has no direct influence, the Israel-Hamas conflict is putting serious strain on the Albanese government, internally and externally, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: Albanese government under more heat as it tries to navigate its position on Gaza conflict

image.altText: two black and white teen students with backpacks facing away from the camera, another sits behind a computer with their hand up.

props.synopsis: City public primary schools have dominated the list of high-performing schools, according to analysis of NAPLAN data, as school results are released today.

title.children: High-performing schools in each state and territory revealed as state NAPLAN results released

image.altText: Floodwaters cut traffic

props.synopsis: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper is moving slowly, meaning heavy rain is expected again today in the far north, after flooded roads made many areas inaccessible for Ergon Energy repair crews yesterday.

title.children: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper leaves Far North Queensland residents isolated by floodwaters, cut off from services with no power

image.altText: A man and a woman standing on a dirt bank in the middle of a rice paddock flooded with water.

props.synopsis: Farmers who fed 22 million people from their one rice crop are unsure they will stick with industry that's plagued with water woes.

title.children: Water woes from prolonged buyback talks tempts top grower to cash in and head to the coast

image.altText: Jacinta Allan appears thoughtful, wearing a white hard-hat and high-vis vest at an outdoor press conference.

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan says the cost of the North East Link project has increased to almost $26 billion, due to additional works for the road and tunnel project as well as increased pressures on the budget.

title.children: 'Great frustration' as budget for Victoria's most costly road project surges by $10 billion

image.altText: A woman being comforted at a press conference

props.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg's lawyer say they will seek significant compensation from the New South Wales government after her convictions were quashed.

title.children: Expert 'not surprised' if Kathleen Folbigg receives more than $10 million in compensation

image.altText: Image of a young blond boy wearing a striped rugby shirt while smiling into the camera.

props.synopsis: A British teenager who disappeared six years ago is found in southern France after fleeing a spiritualist mountain community, according to a driver who crossed paths with him and informed police.

title.children: British boy missing for six years found in southern France after fleeing mountain commune

image.altText: A close-up of a woman eating a potato chip

props.synopsis: The humble bag of chips has come a long way, with flavours like cheeseburger, curry, and cucumber now available. To get the flavours right involves a bit of technology — and a whole lot of noses.

title.children: Forget salt and vinegar, did you know there are 1,400 bona fide flavours of chips? This is how they're created
